TopicTitle: Bizzare space center behavior - some work partially, some don't at all

Articles.Content:
This all started happening when I was trying to build a Mk3 SSTO from scratch. After the tested design scratched the ocean surface and got obliterated, I hit the "Esc" key out of frustration to revert the flight. Then the game seemed to freeze, and the "esc" menu and crash menu seemed to merge on the screen. At this point the game wouldn't respond to any in game clicks. I was able to close the game by manually closing the window (I don't play in full-screen mode).

Afterwards, when I load up the same career, entering buildings seems to be really messed up:

- I cannot enter the tracking station

- I cannot enter the VAB

- I cannot enter the Spaceplane Hangar

- I can enter everything else and interact with it, but cannot exit back to the space center

- Clicking on the launchpad or runway allows me to pick a vehicle to launch, but I get an error when attempting to launch - no size information is available

- Also quitting the game cannot be done normally, the in game menu doesn't respond to clicks and the game has to be closed by clicking the "X"

Loading up another career altogether reacts in the game acting normally. Any help is appreciated.

Edited January 1, 2015 by Bigun

Well... Log files would help confirm this, but I suspect that you ran across the bug where the game freezes when kerbals who have logged an achievement or been rescued from a contract are deleted from the roster.

Have a look at this thread and see if that helps. You'd be looking for names of the kerbals who were aboard your crashed ship.

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/105651-FIX-KSC-Buildings-Lock-Up-Can-t-Click-on-Anything-Firing-Kerbal-Crashes-Game

Cheers,

-Claw
Confirmed this was my issue. Thanks Claw!
